value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: A database connection URL used to connect to a database. May contain database system name, host, port, database name and some parameters. The exact syntax of a database connection URL is specified by your DBMS.
value.name: Database Connection URL

value.description: The maximum amount of time that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before failing, or -1 to wait indefinitely.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: Database driver class name
value.name: Database Driver Class Name

value.description: Database user name
value.name: Database User

value.description: Optional database driver jar file path url. For example 'file:///var/tmp/mariadb-java-client-1.1.7.jar'
value.name: Database Driver Jar Url

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time, or negative for no limit.
value.name: Max Total Connections

value.description: The password for the database user
value.name: Password

value.description: Query to be used when testing the Datasource.
value.name: Validation Query

value.description: Provide the DDL or DML statement. Return values will be ignored.
value.name: Statement

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

value.description: SQL select query
value.name: SQL select query

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

entry.value: select x.invalid_count, y.total_count, x.invalid_count/y.total_count as invalid_pct, CASE WHEN (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100 >= ${invalidThresholdPercentage} then 'false' else 'true' end as valid, CASE WHEN x.invalid_count/y.total_count >= 0.10 then concat('Invalid. The data has ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is above the threshold of ','${invalidThresholdPercentage}%' ) else concat('Valid. This job has passed validation with ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is below the threshold of ${invalidThresholdPercentage}%') end as validation_message, x.processing_dttm from ( select metricvalue as invalid_count, 'INVALID_COUNT' as type, m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'INVALID_COUNT' ) x inner join ( select metricvalue as total_count, 'TOTAL_COUNT' as type,m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'TOTAL_COUNT') y on y.processing_dttm = x.processing_dttm

value.description: SQL select query
value.name: SQL select query

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

value.name: Target Table Properties

value.name: System feed category

value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

entry.value: select x.invalid_count, y.total_count, x.invalid_count/y.total_count as invalid_pct, CASE WHEN (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100 >= ${invalidThresholdPercentage} then 'false' else 'true' end as valid, CASE WHEN x.invalid_count/y.total_count >= 0.10 then concat('Invalid. The data has ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is above the threshold of ','${invalidThresholdPercentage}%' ) else concat('Valid. This job has passed validation with ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is below the threshold of ${invalidThresholdPercentage}%') end as validation_message, x.processing_dttm from ( select metricvalue as invalid_count, 'INVALID_COUNT' as type, m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'INVALID_COUNT' ) x inner join ( select metricvalue as total_count, 'TOTAL_COUNT' as type,m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'TOTAL_COUNT') y on y.processing_dttm = x.processing_dttm

value.description: Feed timestamp that identifies the current feed partition
value.name: Feed partition value

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge. Valid values are SYNC,MERGE,DEDUPE_AND_MERGE. Sync will completely overwrite the target table with the source data. Merge will append the data into the target partitions. Dedupe will insert into the target partition but ensure no duplicate rows are remaining.
value.name: Merge Strategy

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

entry.value: select x.invalid_count, y.total_count, x.invalid_count/y.total_count as invalid_pct, CASE WHEN (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100 >= ${invalidThresholdPercentage} then 'false' else 'true' end as valid, CASE WHEN (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100 >= ${invalidThresholdPercentage} then concat('Invalid. The data has ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is above the threshold of ','${invalidThresholdPercentage}%' ) else concat('Valid. This job has passed validation with ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is below the threshold of ${invalidThresholdPercentage}%') end as validation_message, x.processing_dttm from ( select metricvalue as invalid_count, 'INVALID_COUNT' as type, m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'INVALID_COUNT' ) x inner join ( select metricvalue as total_count, 'TOTAL_COUNT' as type,m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'TOTAL_COUNT') y on y.processing_dttm = x.processing_dttm

value.name: Table Type

value.description: Additional tables to drop separated by comma.
value.name: Additional Tables

value.name: System feed category

entry.value: select x.invalid_count, y.total_count, x.invalid_count/y.total_count as invalid_pct, CASE WHEN (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100 >= ${invalidThresholdPercentage} then 'false' else 'true' end as valid, CASE WHEN (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100 >= ${invalidThresholdPercentage} then concat('Invalid. The data has ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is above the threshold of ','${invalidThresholdPercentage}%' ) else concat('Valid. This job has passed validation with ', (x.invalid_count/y.total_count)*100,'% of the rows invalid. This is below the threshold of ${invalidThresholdPercentage}%') end as validation_message, x.processing_dttm from ( select metricvalue as invalid_count, 'INVALID_COUNT' as type, m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'INVALID_COUNT' ) x inner join ( select metricvalue as total_count, 'TOTAL_COUNT' as type,m.max_date as processing_dttm from ${category}.${feed}_profile inner join (SELECT MAX(processing_dttm) as max_date from ${category}.${feed}_profile) m on m.max_date = processing_dttm where columnname = '(ALL)' and metrictype = 'TOTAL_COUNT') y on y.processing_dttm = x.processing_dttm

value.description: Feed timestamp that identifies the current feed partition
value.name: Feed partition value

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge. Valid values are SYNC,MERGE,DEDUPE_AND_MERGE. Sync will completely overwrite the target table with the source data. Merge will append the data into the target partitions. Dedupe will insert into the target partition but ensure no duplicate rows are remaining.
value.name: Merge Strategy

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

value.description: Fully qualified name of the source table
value.name: Source table

value.description: Fully qualified name of the target table
value.name: Target table

value.description: Partition specification in format: field|type|formula field|type|formula
value.name: Partition Specification

value.description: A database connection URL used to connect to a database. May contain database system name, host, port, database name and some parameters. The exact syntax of a database connection URL is specified by your DBMS.
value.name: Database Connection URL

value.description: The maximum amount of time that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before failing, or -1 to wait indefinitely.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: Database driver class name
value.name: Database Driver Class Name

value.description: Database user name
value.name: Database User

value.description: Optional database driver jar file path url. For example 'file:///var/tmp/mariadb-java-client-1.1.7.jar'
value.name: Database Driver Jar Url

value.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time, or negative for no limit.
value.name: Max Total Connections

value.description: The password for the database user
value.name: Password

value.description: Whether to load the entire table or perform an incremental extract
value.name: Load Strategy

value.description: The database where the source table resides
value.name: Source Database Connection

value.description: System category of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed category

value.description: Field names (in order) to read from the source table. ie. the select fields. The format is separated by newline. Inconsistent order will cause corruption of the downstream Hive data.
value.name: Source Fields

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: Name of table including schema (if applicable)
value.name: Source Table

value.description: Only records older than the backoff period will be eligible for pickup. This can be used in the ILM use case to define a retention period. Recommended: >5m
value.name: Backoff Period

value.description: The minimum unit of data eligible to load. For the ILM case, this would be DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Minimum Time Unit

value.description: Amount of time to overlap into the last load date to ensure long running transactions missed by previous load weren't missed. Recommended: >0s
value.name: Overlap Period

value.description: Name of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed name

value.description: Source field containing a modified date for tracking incremental load
value.name: Date Field

value.description: Think Big metadata service
value.name: Metadata Service

value.description: SQL select query
value.name: SQL select query

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

entry.value: SELECT d.NAME DATABASE_NAME, d.OWNER_NAME OWNER, t.CREATE_TIME, t.TBL_NAME, t.TBL_TYPE, c.COLUMN_NAME, c.TYPE_NAME FROM ${config.hive.schema}.COLUMNS_V2 c JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.SDS s on s.CD_ID = c.CD_ID JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.TBLS t ON s.SD_ID=t.SD_ID JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.DBS d on d.DB_ID = t.DB_ID where d.name = '${category}'and t.tbl_name like '${feed}%';

value.description: SQL select query
value.name: SQL select query

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

entry.value: SELECT d.NAME DATABASE_NAME, d.OWNER_NAME OWNER, t.CREATE_TIME, t.TBL_NAME, t.TBL_TYPE, c.COLUMN_NAME, c.TYPE_NAME FROM ${config.hive.schema}.COLUMNS_V2 c JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.SDS s on s.CD_ID = c.CD_ID JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.TBLS t ON s.SD_ID=t.SD_ID JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.DBS d on d.DB_ID = t.DB_ID where d.name = '${category}'and t.tbl_name like '${feed}%';

value.description: SQL select query
value.name: SQL select query

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

allowableValues.description: An implemenation that stores metadata locally in memory (for development-only)
An implemenation that accesses metadata via the metadata service REST API

value.description: Specifies which implementation of the metadata providers should be used
value.name: Implementation

value.description: The base URL to the metadata server when the REST API client implementation is chosen.
value.name: rest-client-url

value.description: System category of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed category

value.description: Name of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed name

value.description: Think Big metadata service
value.name: Metadata Service

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Result

value.description: Service supplying the implementations of the various metadata providers.
value.name: Metadata Provider Service

value.description: The category name of this feed. The default is to have this name automatically set when the feed is created. Normally you do not need to change the default value.
value.name: System feed category

value.description: Service that manages the cleanup of feeds.
value.name: Feed Cleanup Event Service

value.description: The system name of this feed. The default is to have this name automatically set when the feed is created. Normally you do not need to change the default value.
value.name: System feed name

value.description: Whether to load the entire table or perform an incremental extract
value.name: Load Strategy

value.description: The database where the source table resides
value.name: Source Database Connection

value.description: System category of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed category

value.description: Field names (in order) to read from the source table. ie. the select fields. The format is separated by newline. Inconsistent order will cause corruption of the downstream Hive data.
value.name: Source Fields

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: Name of table including schema (if applicable)
value.name: Source Table

value.description: Only records older than the backoff period will be eligible for pickup. This can be used in the ILM use case to define a retention period. Recommended: >5m
value.name: Backoff Period

value.description: The minimum unit of data eligible to load. For the ILM case, this would be DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Minimum Time Unit

value.description: Amount of time to overlap into the last load date to ensure long running transactions missed by previous load weren't missed. Recommended: >0s
value.name: Overlap Period

value.description: Name of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed name

value.description: Source field containing a modified date for tracking incremental load
value.name: Date Field

value.description: Determines how stream of records is exposed: either as a sequence of single Objects (none) (i.e. writing every Object to a new line), or as an array of Objects (array).
value.name: JSON container options

value.description: Determines if the resulting output for empty records or a single record should be wrapped in a container array as specified by 'JSON container options'
value.name: Wrap Single Record

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be parsed as Avro or cannot be converted to JSON for any reason
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been converted to JSON
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to 'match' if one or all Expressions match, depending on the configuration of the Routing Strategy property
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

entry.value: SELECT d.NAME DATABASE_NAME, d.OWNER_NAME OWNER, t.CREATE_TIME, t.TBL_NAME, t.TBL_TYPE, c.COLUMN_NAME, c.TYPE_NAME FROM ${config.hive.schema}.COLUMNS_V2 c JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.SDS s on s.CD_ID = c.CD_ID JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.TBLS t ON s.SD_ID=t.SD_ID JOIN ${config.hive.schema}.DBS d on d.DB_ID = t.DB_ID where d.name = '${category}'and t.tbl_name like '${feed}%';

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: IO Buffer Size

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

value.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Block Size

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Replication

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Provide format and delimiter specification. This is the full clause starting with the INPUTFORMAT such as: INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TextInputFormat' OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.HiveIgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat'
value.name: Feed Table Storage Format

value.description: Provide list of partition columns column-delimited
value.name: Partition specification

value.description: Pipe-delim format with the specifications for the fields (column name|data type|comment
value.name: Field specification

value.description: Provide storage format specification for the target tables
value.name: Target Table Format

This config will be used in place of spark.core.connection.ack.wait.timeout, spark.akka.timeout, spark.storage.blockManagerSlaveTimeoutMs, spark.shuffle.io.connectionTimeout, spark.rpc.askTimeout or spark.rpc.lookupTimeout if they are not configured.

value.description: Feed timestamp that identifies the current feed partition
value.name: Feed partition value

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge. Valid values are SYNC,MERGE,DEDUPE_AND_MERGE. Sync will completely overwrite the target table with the source data. Merge will append the data into the target partitions. Dedupe will insert into the target partition but ensure no duplicate rows are remaining.
value.name: Merge Strategy

value.description: Path to script file to execute. Only one of Script File or Script Body may be used
value.name: Script File

value.description: The engine to execute scripts
value.name: Script Engine

value.description: Body of script to execute. Only one of Script File or Script Body may be used
value.name: Script Body

value.description: Comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories which contain modules required by the script.
value.name: Module Directory

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed to be processed
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that were successfully processed
relationships.name: success

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

entry.key: Max Data to Post per Second

value.description: The maximum amount of data to send per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Post per Second
value.name: Max Data to Post per Second

value.description: If the Send as FlowFile property is true, specifies the max data size for a batch of FlowFiles to send in a single HTTP POST. If not specified, each FlowFile will be sent separately. If the Send as FlowFile property is false, this property is ignored
value.name: Max Batch Size

value.description: Determines the GZIP Compression Level to use when sending the file; the value must be in the range of 0-9. A value of 0 indicates that the file will not be GZIP'ed
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If true, will package the FlowFile's contents and attributes together and send the FlowFile Package; otherwise, will send only the FlowFile's content
value.name: Send as FlowFile

value.description: What to report as the User Agent when we connect to the remote server
value.name: User Agent

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

value.description: The URL to POST to. The first part of the URL must be static. However, the path of the URL may be defined using the Attribute Expression Language. For example, https://${hostname} is not valid, but https://1.1.1.1:8080/files/${nf.file.name} is valid.
value.name: URL

value.description: How long to wait when attempting to connect to the remote server before giving up
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: How long to wait between receiving segments of data from the remote server before giving up and discarding the partial file
value.name: Data Timeout

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Username required to access the URL
value.name: Username

value.description: Specifies whether or not to use Chunked Encoding to send the data. This property is ignored in the event the contents are compressed or sent as FlowFiles.
value.name: Use Chunked Encoding

value.description: Password required to access the URL
value.name: Password

entry.key: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

value.description: Specifies the Regular Expression that determines the names of FlowFile attributes that should be sent as HTTP Headers
value.displayName: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)
value.name: Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

value.description: The Content-Type to specify for the content of the FlowFile being POSTed if Send as FlowFile is false. In the case of an empty value after evaluating an expression language expression, Content-Type defaults to application/octet-stream
value.name: Content-Type

entry.key: Max Data to Post per Second
Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

relationships.description: Files that fail to send will transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that are successfully send will be transferred to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The absolute path to the HDFS directory to be permanently deleted. One directory per line.
value.name: Directory

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed to be processed
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that removed a directory
relationships.name: success

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: IO Buffer Size

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

value.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Block Size

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Replication

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Provide the DDL or DML statement. Return values will be ignored.
value.name: Statement

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

relationships.description: SQL query execution failed. Incoming FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successfully created FlowFile from .
relationships.name: success

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.name: Permissions

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.name: Directory

value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Qualified classname of the Spark job application class
value.name: SparkHome

value.description: How much RAM to allocate to the executor
value.name: Executor Memory

value.description: Optional Yarn Queue
value.name: Yarn Queue

value.description: Path to the JAR file containing the Spark job application
value.name: ApplicationJAR

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: Comma separated arguments to be passed into the main as args
value.name: MainArgs

value.description: The name of the spark application
value.name: Spark Application Name

value.description: A file or a list of files separated by comma which should be added to the class path
value.name: Extra JARs

value.description: Qualified classname of the Spark job application class
value.name: MainClass

value.description: The number of executor cores to be used
value.name: Executor Cores

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: The Spark master
value.name: SparkMaster

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: The number of exectors to be used
value.name: Number of Executors

value.description: How much RAM to allocate to the driver
value.name: Driver Memory

value.description: Default timeout for all network interactions. This config will be used in place of spark.core.connection.ack.wait.timeout, spark.akka.timeout, spark.storage.blockManagerSlaveTimeoutMs, spark.shuffle.io.connectionTimeout, spark.rpc.askTimeout or spark.rpc.lookupTimeout if they are not configured.
value.name: Network Timeout

relationships.description: Spark execution failed. Incoming FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Successful result.
relationships.name: success

value.description: Path to script file to execute. Only one of Script File or Script Body may be used
value.name: Script File

value.description: The engine to execute scripts
value.name: Script Engine

value.description: Body of script to execute. Only one of Script File or Script Body may be used
value.name: Script Body

value.description: Comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories which contain modules required by the script.
value.name: Module Directory
